result.execSummary:
The defendant Zjoran A. Hinton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
Reimburse for the Buy money of $440.00.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination thereof.
Have psychological evaluation and comply with all recommendations.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases to monitor compliance.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment and with permission of the DOC. 
Submit a DNA sample if not previously done so. 
Eligible for Substance Abuse program and Challenge Incarceration program after 4 years.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Count 1 and with sentencing he is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Zjoran A. Hinton
Current: Stanley Corr Institution, #532151, 100 Corrections Drive, Stanley, WI 54768 United States  (Effective: 03-09-2017)
Prior: 3001 Minnesota Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on September 9, 2016
Count 1 & 2

Defendant Zjoran A. Hinton in court with attorney Alex J Hewett. Defendant Zjoran A. Hinton in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
9:24 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  There are no corrections or additions. 
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Hewett makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions parties regarding jail credit. 
Atty Hewett makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Constable makes statements to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - 
10 years prison with 6 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years Extended Supervision, Concurrent with sentence he is currently serving. 

Count 2 - 
10 years prison with 6 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years Extended Supervision, Concurrent with Count 1 and with sentence he is currently serving. 

Condition of Extended Supervision: 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases to monitor compliance.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment and with permission of the DOC. 
Have psychological evaluation and comply with all recommendations. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Money to be taken out of prison account for payment of the court costs but not to exceed more than 50% of the total amount he has going into that account.
Submit a DNA sample if not previously done so. 
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment or go to school fulltime or a combination thereof. 
Reimburse for the Buy money of $440.00. 

Eligible for SAB and CIP after 4 years. 

Court questions defendant. 
Atty Constable makes statements to the Court. 

Both parties retain the PSI confidentially in their files. 

Warrants are vacated on 15CF58, 09CM180, 08FO1069 and 06FO1311 Judgments be entered for tax intercept purposes in the future.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus - Original filed in 16CF28

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on September 9, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Zjoran A. Hinton in court with attorney Alex J Hewett. Defendant Zjoran A. Hinton in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 16CF-28 and 16CF-34.

1:50 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances. 

These matters are set for a plea today.

There is a plea agreement.

16CF-34: Defendant is pleading to Count 1 and Count 2.
16CF-28 will be dismissed and read in.

Parties request a PSI and set for separate sentencing date.
State will agree to cap recommendations at 7 years.

Atty Hewett concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
GUILTY 16CF-34 Count 1.
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY 16CF-34 Count 2.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Hewett for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CF-34: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CF-34: Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CF-28: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.

A recent PSI has been done.

PSI to be completed by Sept 6th. Copies to be forwarded to counsel.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is ordered revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 09:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2016 at 10:15 am.

3:16 p.m. Defendant Zjoran A. Hinton in court with attorney Alex J Hewett. Defendant Zjoran A. Hinton in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing both cases 16CF28 and 16CF34.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:15 am.

State files Information on both cases 16CF34 and 16CF28.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.
